intro: Windmannia reticulata, commonly known as the net-veined windmannia, is a member of the Acanthaceae family. It is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and opposite, lance-shaped leaves with a distinctive net-like venation pattern. Its flowers are typically small and clustered in whorls, displaying a range of colors from white to pink. Windmannia reticulata is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and unique appearance.
